job.title: Data Scientist
job.description:
Several days a week will be in our Redwood City office. Please be within commuting distance.
Who We Are
TruckLabs is a technology company on a mission to transform the trucking industry through connected hardware and innovative software products. We apply advanced engineering and data science techniques to partner with the most advanced fleets in the country to improve their real-world fuel economy - driving bottom line savings and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. Our first product, TruckWings™, is the industry’s first active aerodynamics product for Class 8 trucks that automatically closes the tractor-trailer gap at highway speeds. Deployed across major national fleets, TruckWings have completed over 250 million miles of highway driving. TruckWings are controlled by a proprietary cloud-connected telematics device which both operates and measures the performance of TruckWings and the trucks. With these technologies, we are making a dent in the 300M metric tons of greenhouse gas emissions produced annually by tractor-trailers, while also increasing the profitability of our customers. Learn more at www.trucklabs.com.
Candidates need to have 3-5 years of experience, with proven results in structuring, processing and visualizing raw data to create business impacting insights and supporting products. This position will be based out of our office in Redwood City, California.
About You
We are looking for a very curious data scientist who enjoys a deep dive into the raw data to ask the right set of questions and find the answers to those questions. You will build tools and infrastructure that provide data cleansing & transformation, create statistical, predictive and optimization models leading to actionable insights for new data products, as well as performance metrics to drive business and product improvements. You will analyze on-road data with a fine-toothed comb and develop product requirements from first principles. Your analysis will be critical in setting direction for the product and engineering teams.
What You’ll Do
You will own the analytical frameworks that drive decision making and direction for the product roadmap
Enrich insights by supplementing telematics data with relevant data sources
Build models from the ground up - from data exploration to feature engineering, model development + optimization, and deployment into production
Design rigorous experiments and interpret results to draw actionable conclusions
Work cross-functionally with team leaders (in Engineering, Product, Operations, Marketing, etc.) to explain your analysis and make recommendations
Facilitate objective decision making across the company by democratizing data through dashboards and other analytical tools
Operationalize data gathering and machine-learning infrastructure
Required Skills and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or other quantitative field; advanced degree a plus
3+ years of experience working as a data scientist
Knowledge of machine learning techniques, especially deep understanding for their benefits and drawbacks in real-world applications
Excellent statistical intuition derived from practical, hands-on experience
Proficiency in Python, SQL, PySpark, and ETL patterns and tools
Experience with scientific computing and analysis packages such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, dplyr, or ggplot2
Experience with machine learning libraries and packages such as Scikit-learn, PyTorch, Caffe2, TensorFlow, Keras or Theano
Experience working on Cloud computing technology (AWS/Google Cloud/Microsoft Azure)
Experience in the design, analysis, and interpretation of A/B tests in a large data environment
Experience building predictive systems.
Ability to work in a fast-paced and continuously changing environment.
Preferred Skills:
Experience with GIS data, including Google Maps Platform
Understanding of Big Data Technologies like Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark and MapReduce.
Knowledge in the Transportation or Logistics domain.
